newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end up 1.3 pct on blue chips.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end up 1.3 pct on blue chips.

text.p: Active late buying on blue chips boosted Taiwan share prices to close fairly higher on Saturday, brokers said.
The index ended up 81.74 points, or 1.30 percent, at 6,371.97. Turnover was an active T$38.24 billion.
Brokers also attributed the rise to good performance in the over-the-counter market, which boosted sentiment.

"The OTC market has been performing well for three consecutive days, and many expected the Securities and Exchange Commission may open credit trading for the OTC market in the near future," said Alex Yang of National Securities.
Plastics rose most, with Formosa Plastics up T$3 to T$61.5.
Electronics were also strong, with Acer up T$1.3 to T$40.6 and First International up T$1.3 to T$35.9.
Other blue chips or large-capital shares also attracted buying, with Formosa Chemical Fibre up 80 cents to T$34 and Hualon up 80 cents to T$24.5.
For next week, a firming trend was expected within a 6,250-6,500 range.
"The central bank is scheduled to hold a board meeting next Thursday, and many expected it to further loosen money policy to boost the economy," Yang said.-James Peng (5080815)
